page.title: 04BUILDINGS AND MONUMENTS (1)
page.content: { BUILDINGS AND MONUMENTS (1) Alne church was built by the christian Normans in about 1150 it consisted of the nave,chancel and tower.The north aisle and side chapel were added on later.The main{Doorway} has old Norman carvings in the stone archway around the edge.Some of these are symbolical christian creatures such as Vulpis the fox,Hiena the Hyena and Panthera the Panther.As you enter the church to your left is the Norman{ {Font}.This was and still is used to christen babies.There is a {Virgins {crown}which was used when a maiden died.It was carried in front of the body at the funeral procession and afterwards hung in the church.The { {Pulpit}is dated 1626 and the wooden { {Altar} 1628 .
